page.title: 13GREAVES HALL HOSPITAL,BANKS
page.content: WE WENT TO GREAVES HALL HOSPITAL TO SEE THE SORT OF WORK DONE THERE.WE WERE LEAD ROUND BY THE DEPUTY ADMINISTRATOR. THERE ARE TWENTY ONE WARDS WITH OVER FIVE HUNDRED PATIENTS AND FIVE HUNDRED AND FIFTY STAFF. EACH WARD HAS THREE OR FOUR NURSES. THE HOSPITAL WAS TAKEN OVER BY THE N.H.S. IN 1946. THE MAN WHO BUILT THE HOSPITAL WAS THOMAS SCARISBRICK IN THE EARLY 1900'S AND IT IS MOCK TUDOR IN STYLE. THE MANSION HOUSE IS USED AS AN ADMINISTRATIVE CENTRE.THERE ARE TWO CHURCHES ON SITE - A ROMAN CATHOLIC CHURCH AND AN ANGLICAN CHURCH. THERE ARE SERVICES EACH WEEK. THERE ARE OTHER FACILITIES ON SITE. THE HOSPITAL IS JUST OFF THE A565 ROAD AND IS A VERY IMPORTANT EMPLOYER IN THE AREA.
